info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 19 at 10:38PM PST until February 22 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM SUNDAY TO 4 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow accumulations of 8 to 12 inches expected. Localized higher amounts are possible. Snowfall rates of up to half an inch and hour are possible at times. * WHERE...Southern Oregon Cascades and eastern Douglas County foothills, including Crater Lake National Park, Diamond Lake Junction, and portions of highways 140, 62, 138, and 230 over the Cascades. * WHEN...From 4 AM Sunday to 4 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult due to slick, snow covered roads. Periods of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibilities at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This will be a longer duration event, with snow expected to occur through Tuesday. This Advisory represents the highest confidence locations for impactful snowfall over the next 48 hours. Updates and extensions are likely. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.comfor latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
